questions.search: Is Huawei MateBook X Pro worth it?
questions.more: The Huawei Matebook X Pro is just thin enough to allow for a USB-A port on one side. Two models are available, both of which use Intel's 8th-generation parts: the Core i5/8GB memory/256GB SSD version, which lacks a discrete GPU; and the Core i7 version, with 16GB of memory/512GB SSD and the Nvidia MX150.Mar 7, 2019

children.search: Is Huawei MateBook X Pro good for programming?
children.more: The Huawei Matebook X Pro is an excellent all-purpose workstation. It's powerful enough for most things, and the addition of an entry-level graphics card means it's suited to a bit of casual gaming too. The screen is bright and lush, while the keyboard is ridiculously comfortable.Mar 19, 2019
children.article_header: Review: The Huawei Matebook X Pro (2019) is the best laptop I've ...
children.parent: Is Huawei MateBook X Pro worth it?

children.search: Is the Huawei MateBook X Pro good for gaming?
children.more: Good for gaming, within limits Huawei has wisely paired its Intel Core processor with Nvidia's MX150 graphics, a competent entry-level graphics chip that's becoming common even in systems as light as the MateBook X Pro. ... Opting for an MX150 makes the MateBook X Pro a moderately capable gaming PC.

children.search: When did the Huawei MateBook X Pro come out?
children.more: Huawei's announced April 2019 as the MateBook X Pro and MateBook 14's release date, but it's only talking about global pricing, and in Euros, with the Core i5 MateBook X Pro running you 1,599 Euro (around $1,809) and the Core i7 MateBook X Pro costing 1,999 Euro (around $2,262).Feb 24, 2019

children.search: What is Huawei MateBook X Pro?
children.more: The Huawei Matebook X Pro is the first laptop in Huawei's lineup to feature what the company is calling "FullView" design, giving the laptop a screen to body ratio of 91% The display is a 13.9 inch LTPS touchscreen with an aspect ratio of 3:2.
